name: McGill Dataverse
description: The McGill University Dataverse is a research data repository for McGill faculty, students, and staff.

name: DANDI Archive
description: DANDI Archive is a BRAIN Initiative archive for publishing and sharing neurophysiology data including electrophysiology, optophysiology, and behavioral time-series, and images from immunostaining experiments.

name: Open Science Framework
description: OSF captures "products of the research lifecycle, including developing a research idea, designing a study, storing and analyzing collected data, and writing and publishing reports or papers."

name: Aperture Neuro
description: "The purpose of Aperture Neuro is to enable a diverse approach to sharing and communicating high quality, community-based, open neuroscience while bringing transparency and interactivity to the publishing process."

name: Open Behavior
description: A repository of cutting edge, open source tools for advancing behavioral neuroscience research

name: OpenNeuro
description: "A free and open platform for validating and sharing BIDS-compliant MRI, PET, MEG, EEG, and iEEG data"

name: DataLad
description: Keep code, data, containers under control with git and git-annex

name: Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS)
description: "A simple and intuitive way to organize and describe your neuroimaging and behavioral data."

name: PsychoPy
description: "PsychoPy is a free cross-platform package allowing you to run a wide range of experiments in the behavioral sciences (neuroscience, psychology, psychophysics...)"

name: Open Ephys
description: A worker coop that develops and distributes open-source hardware tools for neuroscience.

name: UCLA Miniscope
description: Open-source, user-friendly miniature head-mounted microscope for neural imaging in freely behaving animals.

name: Federated Research Data Repository (FRDR)
description: The Federated Research Data Repository (FRDR) is a bilingual publishing platform for sharing and preserving Canadian research data. It is a curated, general-purpose repository, custom built for large datasets.

name: Neurodata Without Borders (NWB)
description: NWB provides a common self-describing format and standard ideal for archiving and sharing neurophysiology data.

name: Clinical Biospecimen Imaging and Genetic Repository (C-BIG)
description: Biorepository of data and biological samples from patients with neurological disease and healthy control.

name: PYthon Neural Analysis Package (pynapple)
description: Pynapple is an open-source light-weight python library for neurophysiological data analysis. The goal is to offer a versatile set of tools to study typical data in the field, i.e. time series (spike times, behavioral events, etc.) and time intervals (trials, brain states, etc.). It also provides users with generic functions for neuroscience such as tuning curves and cross-correlograms.

name: HardwareX
description: HardwareX is a multidisciplinary, open access, peer-reviewed journal which publishes articles that describe the design, construction and customization of scientific devices and equipment.

name: Open Labware
description: Open-Labware.net is a repository of open source plans and protocols to 3D-Print lab equipment.

name: OpenBCI
description: OpenBCI creates open-source tools for biosensing and neuroscience.

name: Opentrons
description: Open-source liquid handling automated robots for scientists.

name: 3Dneuro
description: Open-source hardware for systems neuroscience - microdrive systems, rat and mouse head fixation, and more.

name: Expyriment
description: Open-source and platform independent light-weight Python library for designing and conducting timing-critical behavioural and neuroimaging experiments

name: Psychtoolbox
description: The Psychophysics Toolbox is a set of freely available functions that extends MATLAB and Octave with functions for research-grade stimulus presentation and response collection for neuroscience and other application domains.

name: jsPsych
description: Open-source JavaScript framework for creating behavioral experiments that run in a web browser.

name: lab.js
description:
lab.js is a free, open, online study builder
for the behavioral and cognitive sciences.

name: StimuliApp
description: StimuliApp is a free open-source app designed to create psychophysical tests with precise timing on iOS and iPadOS devices.

name: Dryad
description: Dryad is an open data publishing platform and a community committed to the open availability and routine re-use of all research data.

name: Zenodo
description: Simple and innovative service enabling researchers to share and showcase research results (data, code, protocols, etc.) from all fields of science.
